title: Why do some people give up in their matches?
body:
I was playing a game as Rengar Jungle and our lanes started losing. I tried my best to get all of them back into the game, but didn't get too far with that.
We were losing pretty hard until my team decided to try surrender at 20.

I voted "No" because I thought I was fed enough to 1shot their adc (and i was) and the surrender vote failed for 3/2.

However this is where things went bad:

Our TF said "bye" and started just going after people hitting them and our Irelia was dancing at our nexus.

Eventually when they did get to our nexus a few minutes later, Irelia sold all her items for 3 sightstones and TF sold everything for a Frozen Mallet and went AFK in base.

The thing is, we were holding base pretty well as 3. They took quite some minutes to finish our nexus off. Why do some people give up completely , even though we had a chance at winning? Because things don't go their way?

Did they troll just to avoid LeaverBuster? Or was it because they wanted the game to end faster?

replies.body: Because Emotions are hard to deal with.  When you get angry, or sad you really cant play to your full potential anymore and compound that with the inability to trust your allies in SoloQ and you are pretty much doomed to lose... why try after that point?
I must say I was pretty frustrated because of Irelia and TF trolling. Yet I still played the game. That's not a reason to troll and be a jerk to other people and wasting their time.
Its not easy to understand until you yourself reach that breaking point emotionally.  Its not right, but it is understandable.
And this is where imo you're being the better person, but what can you do?

I cant say much for that specific occasion, but the most common reason I want to surrender is the enemy team showing great teamwork and coordination while our team is all running around like chickens with our heads cut off ignoring pings and chat.  That or when someone refuses to stop engaging a snowbally champ until they become so fed the game isn't even real anymore lol :)

(this may only apply to me and the rest of unranked queue)

Mainly just time constraints, and I am one of those people that vote to surrender. 

The way I look at it, if it's mid-game and 2 or more lanes are losing, things look bleak but there's still hope. 
If the enemy team has reached the base and you're team has only gotten 1 or 2 towers. There's not much helping your team.
If between 15-25 or 20-30 minutes in (basically 10 minutes have gone by) and you're team still hasn't destroyed a tower. The game is lost.

If may feel like you have a chance to make a comeback but the sad reality is, it's very difficult. Basically because you spend a long amount of time defending the onslaught of minion waves and champions. There ends up being no room to relieve pressure.

Of course, unless you have a Tryndamere on your team and he takes on for the team to dive turrets, all hope is gone.

When people see that they are losing, they feel its a lost cause and waste of time, so they surrender to end it and move on. Yet, some games arnt necessarily over just because they are currently losing. If seen teams comeback from simple things like split pushing, getting a baron, or even catching up in levels. Sadly, most people just assume its a lost cause and would rather give up entirely than take the chance for a comeback.
This was a game where we could definetly comeback. I was 6/2 wen they tried to surrender (Died a lot of times beccause 3v5) and I could probably carry that match and we were defending well.
